set2.ques: 1. Which system works on Hardware ?
set2.exp: An operating system (OS) is system software that manages computer hardware and software resources.

set2.ques: 2. Operating system is a general kind of —— software.
set2.exp: Operating system is a general kind of system software.

set2.ques: 3. CPU and memory system are installed an ——
set2.exp: Motherboard is the most essential part of computer and it provide a single socket for CPU whereas for memory, normally one or more slots are available.

set2.ques: 4. What is the full form of “GUI”
set2.exp: A graphical user interface (GUI) is a type of user interface through which users interact with electronic devices via visual indicator representations.

set2.ques: 5. Laser printer made by which company and when?
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 6. BIOS of the computer is stored in ——
set2.exp: BIOS is a program that’s stored in nonvolatile memory such as read-only memory (ROM) or flash memory, making it firmware.

set2.ques: 7. What is the diameter of the droplets of the ink present in the Inkjet printer.
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 8. In which part of the computer pricessing is done.(Processing is done in which part of the computer)
set2.exp: Computer processing is done by CPU( Central processing unit)

set2.ques: 9. Any data of information which enter in the memory of the computer are known as-
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 10. The assembled programme in the ROM is called
set2.exp: Firmware is held in non-volatile memory devices such as ROM, EPROM, or flash memory.

set2.ques: 11. Which interface one bit is transferred at a time.
set2.exp: Serial interface transfers one bit at a time.

set2.ques: 12. Moving your CPUs speed beyond its normal operating range is callled
set2.exp: overclocking is the practice of increasing the clock rate of a computer to exceed that certified by the manufacturer.

set2.ques: 13. Which PORT is typically known as a serial port?
set2.exp: A COM port is a bidirectional serial interface that allows sending and receiving data bit by bit.

set2.ques: 14. Which password is used in the BIOS(CMOS) to prevent end uses from accessing the BIOS contents.
set2.exp: The supervisor (or system) password is used so that only the technician can get into the BIOS (CMOS).

set2.ques: 15. Which of the following form factors does a VGA connector comply with?
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 16. What is the PC equivalent of Fire wire?
set2.exp: FireWire is also called IEEE 1394, is a connecting device used primarily for adding peripherals to a computer.

set2.ques: 17. What is the full form of the EEPROM
set2.A: Electrically Ersable Programmable Read Only Memory
set2.exp: Not Avilable
set2.B: Erasable Electric Programme Read Only Memory

set2.ques: 18. What is an LCD display’s contrst ratio defined as?
set2.exp: Contrast ratio is a figure used to measure the luminance difference between the brightest white and the darkest black.

set2.ques: 19. In which of the following slots would you place an 8X video card?
set2.exp: AGP expansion cards are available in four versions: 1X, 2X, 4X and 8X. AGP-8X is the fastest, with a transfer rate of 2,100 megabytes per second.

set2.ques: 20. Which of the following is the newest type of mouse connection
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 1. Which of the following is a typical speed of a SATA hard drive.
set3.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 2. The Printer connects to your computer with a ……?
set3.exp: The DB25 parallel port is initially used to connect printers, and is sometimes referred to as “printer port” (LPT).

set3.ques: 3. Which company introduced the first desktop laser printer called Laserjet.
set3.exp: The HP(Hewlett-Packard) LaserJet was the world’s first desktop laser printer, introduced in 1984 at about $3,500.

set3.ques: 4. Which of the following in not there in motherboard.
set3.exp: VDT (video display terminal) is a type of equipment for visual display, such as computer screens.

set3.ques: 5. Which of the following printer produces most noise?
set3.exp: DOT matrix printer is an impact printer in which a character is printerd on the paper by the back and forth movement of a print head against the ribbon drenched in ink.

set3.ques: 6. BIOS stands for:
set3.exp: BIOS is a program used by the processor of the computer to get the system started once it is turned on.

set3.ques: 7. What is called VDU
set3.exp: VDU(Visual display unit) is an older British term used to describe any device used with computers to display text and images.

set3.ques: 8. Which of the following are not a part of the ROM.
set3.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 9. Which of the following are not a part of the RAM.
set3.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 10. Which of the following is the permanent memory of the computer:
set3.exp: ROM is non-volatile memory that is the information stored in it data is not lost even if power supply goes off. So, in ROM information is stored permanently.

set3.ques: 11. Which of the following memory programme cann’t be removed by us?
set3.exp: The information from ROM can only be read and it is not possible to write fresh information to it.

set3.ques: 12. What is the name of the microprocessor manufactured by Pentium.
set3.exp: Pentium, Family of microprocessors developed by Intel Corp. Introduced in 1993 as the successor to Intel’s 80486 microprocessor.

set3.ques: 13. What is UNIX.
set3.exp: Unix is a multi-user and multitasking operating system developed in the 1960s in AT&T Labs.
set3.C: No Time sharing and non multiprogramming system
set3.D: Time sharing and multiprogramming system both.

set3.ques: 14. Which of the following is an optical disk.
set3.exp: An optical disk drive (ODD) uses a laser light to read data from or write data to an optical disc. These include CDs, DVDs, and Blu-ray discs.

set3.ques: 15. Efficiency of CPU is measured in:
set3.exp: MIPS( Millions of Instruction Per Second)

set3.ques: 16. What is full form of VGA
set3.exp: A Video Graphics Array (VGA) connector is a standard connector used for computer video output.

set3.ques: 17. What is the name of the 64-bit microprocessor manufactured by AMD
set3.exp: AMD introduces its Opteron and Athlon 64 processor lines, based on its AMD64 architecture which is the first x86-based 64-bit processor architecture.

set3.ques: 18. Text and image and displayed on monitor by individual dots called.
set3.exp: A pixel is represented by a dot or square on a computer monitor display screen. Pixels are the basic building blocks of a digital image.

set3.ques: 19. Intel pentium chip uses:
set3.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 20. Which of the following printer is suitable to print multiple carbon copies at once?
set3.exp: Impact printer refers to printers that work by banging a head or needle against an ink ribbon to make a mark on the paper.
